intro: Ulmus glutinosa, commonly known as the sticky elm, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ulmaceae. It is native to parts of Europe, North Africa, and western Asia. The tree is characterized by its smooth, often sticky bark and heart-shaped leaves that are typically 5–10 cm in length. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged fruits that aid in seed dispersal. The plant is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
